CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 2, 1954, pg. 17 reads: "Pitt's Grid Heroes And Beauties - It happens every autumn-college football, pretty co-eds and the Saturday night dance after the "big football game." On Saturday, Oct. 2, the University of Pittsburgh opens its home football schedule at the Stadium.  On Saturday evening at the North Side Elks, the Emanons, a group of "College Kats," are presenting their "Gridiron Gig."  To put everyone in the mood for teh big weekend, we have pictured above two beautiful Pitt co-eds with two of Pitt's gridiron heroes.  They are Vivian Swain, senior; Henry Ford, Gwendolyn Poinsette, junior, and Chester Rice.  Music for the dance is being provided by Eddie Russ and his All-Stars.  Sam Johnson is Emanons' president and Lou King, social chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of University of Pittsburgh football players, Henry Ford, no. 12 and Chester Rice, no. 24, posed with Vivian Swain and Gwendolyn Poinsette, standing on lawn, another pose
